title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:00 <+sburjan`> so not Junit 3  
00:00 <@cjdelisle> hmm then I do not know.  
00:03 <+sburjan`> if I don.t start with test, they are not even seen as test (do not appear in JUnit tab in eclipse)  
00:05 <+sburjan`> hmm... seems It's using JUnit 3 for some reason, even if I put JUnit 4 in classpath  
00:06 <+sburjan`> how can I find out which version of JUnit eclipse uses when launching a test ?  
00:11 <+sburjan`> seems that depends on what packages I import  
00:11 <+sburjan`> so I could conclude that JUNi4 includes also JUnit 3 .. hmmm  
00:16 <JSeymour> has quit  
01:00 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:31 <abusenius> has quit  
02:13 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
02:16 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
02:16 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
02:16 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
03:54 <@cjdelisle> I froze up agent1  
03:55 <@sdumitriu> Bad boy  
03:55 <mar3lis> how can a macro be locked?  
03:55 <mar3lis> i cant save new changes to the macro class  
03:56 <@cjdelisle> building wysiwyg with a 64bit vm uses more than all the memory and swap combined  
03:56 <@sdumitriu> Works for me  
03:56 <@cjdelisle> The real pain was I watched it happen and before I could type kill it stopped responding  
03:57 <@cjdelisle> how much ram do you have on your machine?  
03:59 <@sdumitriu> echo $MAVEN\_OPTS  
03:59 <@sdumitriu> -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m  
03:59 <@sdumitriu> 4G  
03:59 <@sdumitriu> mar3lis: Do you get an error?  
04:00 <@cjdelisle> gwt seems to spawn a new java process per core in the box so it disregards -Xmx  
04:00 <mar3lis> no i dont  
04:00 <mar3lis> hmm it happens when i try to save and continue, if i save and view its fine  
04:07 <DrLou> has quit  
04:38 <mar3lis> has quit  
05:44 <sdumitriu> has quit  
06:37 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
07:04 <Denis> has quit

07:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:19 <+sburjan`> does anyknone know a free java code coverage tool ?  
07:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:01 <vmassol> has quit  
08:20 <DrLou> has quit  
08:44 <Chami1> has left #xwiki  
09:09 <cjdelisle> has quit  
09:09 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <vmassol> good morning  
09:55 <@cjdelisle> good morning  
10:00 <+sburjan> good morning  
10:11 <vmassol> would be good if we could make the build work on jenkins today....  
10:11 <vmassol> let's make this our challenge of the day!  
10:11 <vmassol> :)  
10:12 <vmassol> seems stuck on agent1: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/186/console  
10:12 <@cjdelisle> yes, agent1 froze up on the wysiwyg build  
10:12 <vmassol> well right now it's at start  
10:13 <@cjdelisle> maybe it's not showing the backscroll but I watched it happen.  
10:13 <@cjdelisle> I suspected it to run out of ram but I wasn't quick enough to kill it  
10:15 <@cjdelisle> 64 bit soubles the size of every pointer, my guess is that is what pushed it over the limit.  
10:19 <vmassol> so what are our options to make jenkins work again?  
10:20 <@cjdelisle> get another box connected or get someone to reset the existing ones.  
10:20 <vmassol> how will resetting the vm be enough?  
10:20 <@cjdelisle> Once reset they need more swap space, they are dangerously underprovisioned  
10:20 <@cjdelisle> no the box is frozen :(  
10:21 <@cjdelisle> 512M of swap --> out of memory + out of swap  
10:21 <vmassol> so tell me what we should have and I'll forward to our admins  
10:21 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <@cjdelisle> At least as much swap as there is ram which is 2GB on one machine and 3GB on the other.  
10:22 <@cjdelisle> #2 it NEEDS an out of memory killer  
10:23 <@cjdelisle> looking for the exact name...  
10:26 <@cjdelisle> http://linux-mm.org/OOM\_Killer  
10:27 <@cjdelisle> It may well be functioning correctly but was not there for us because the swap space is so small.  
10:30 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok an admin is looking at the agents now  
10:37 <vmassol>    
10:38 <vmassol> guys is there an easy way to make a pull request from my cloned repo?  
10:39 <vmassol> my use case: I'm not sure about a change and I'd like some review for it  
10:40 <+tmortagne> I don't think you can, you need to do it form a github fork  
10:40 <vmassol> yeah that's my fear  
10:40 <+tmortagne> at least for the request to appear on github  
10:41 <+tmortagne> but you can always do it directly one to one when someone  
10:41 <vmassol> how can i do that?  
10:41 <vmassol> (without creating a public branch)  
10:41 <+tmortagne> don't know excetly the detail but if you give access to you computer someone can pull it  
10:41 <+tmortagne> like any git repository  
10:49 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <vmassol> admin is adding swap now  
11:37 <vmassol> (on agents)  
11:40 <@cjdelisle> I think it would be wize to move to java6 32 bit. From what I saw gwt spawns as many jvm processes as there are cores so -Xmx is no protection.  
11:42 <vmassol> found a regression:  
11:42 <vmassol> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/export/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Export  
11:43 <vmassol> is empty  
11:43 <vmassol> (export feature)  
11:43 <vmassol> clearing cache now to be sure  
11:43 <vmassol> yes it's mepty  
11:43 <vmassol> so export is not working anymore  
11:44 <vmassol> mflorea: is that sergiu was discussing yesterday with you?  
11:44 <vmassol> s/sergiu/what sergiu/  
11:44 <+mflorea> vmassol: yes  
11:45 <vmassol> do you know if he's working on it? or are you?  
11:47 <+mflorea> I suppose he's working on it, since he introduced this regression. He added a test in the admin sheet to prevent admin section from being exported as PDF. The problem is that the export admin section uses the "export" action, and so nothing is generated.  
11:47 <vmassol> I see....  
11:47 <+mflorea> i.e. the test he added thinks it is handling an export  
11:50 <+sburjan> vmassol: I reported it on the MTR already.  
11:51 <jvdrean> has quit  
11:54 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:57 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you point me to a url saying that javadb is part of java6 (I can find lots of links pointing that it's part of \*\*Sun\*\*'s JDK 1.6  
11:58 <vmassol> goolging  
11:58 <vmassol> googling  
11:59 <vmassol> found that it's not in the JRE btw  
13:05 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:09 <mflorea> has quit  
13:12 <vmassol> cjdelisle: admin says swap should now be o  
13:12 <vmassol> ok  
13:12 <@cjdelisle> great  
13:12 <@cjdelisle> I have a little vps I setup on my desktop and I'm building platform in my own little hudson.  
13:13 <@cjdelisle> If there is interest I could bring a small army of these in as slave nodes.  
13:13 <vmassol> cjdelisle: should we kill http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/186/console ?  
13:14 <@cjdelisle> I've been looking at that.  
13:15 <@cjdelisle> swap is much better  
13:16 <@cjdelisle> this is odd.  
13:16 <@cjdelisle> agent 1 is idle  
13:17 <@cjdelisle> might aswell kill it then start it again and see where it freezes up. It looks like it's deadlocked or something because agent1 is idle, it has ram, it's not swap thrashing.  
13:17 <vmassol> ok  
13:18 <@cjdelisle> I got it  
13:19 <@cjdelisle> On another note, breaking up the build for continuous integration would give us better proformance.  
13:19 <vmassol> I'm not sure  
13:19 <vmassol> rigth now it's already too broken  
13:19 <vmassol> which is causing ltos of false positives  
13:20 <vmassol> and thus giving us bad overall performance....  
13:20 <@cjdelisle> false positives as in tests?  
13:20 <vmassol> so right now we see platform starting to build before commons builds for ex  
13:20 <vmassol> it happens all the time  
13:20 <vmassol> I believe that's because we're using polling  
13:20 <@cjdelisle> oh I see. snapshot versions mismatching  
13:20 <vmassol> vs a hook  
13:21 <vmassol> ideally the github should tell jenkins when it needs to build  
13:21 <vmassol> s/the//  
13:21 <vmassol> so that ordering is kept  
13:22 <@cjdelisle> another idea that would speed things up (also at the cost of correctness) is not building modules which were not changed  
13:26 <@cjdelisle> http://catb.org/esr/jargon/html/magic-story.html  
13:27 <abusenius> has quit  
13:30 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi. Are you fixing the export?  
13:33 <@sdumitriu> You mean XE-919 ?  
13:33 <vmassol> yes  
13:34 <vmassol> (btw misc functional tests is failing too but I think it's the same reason)  
13:34 <vmassol> (since it tests a PDF export)  
13:34 <vmassol> (or maybe not - I'm checking)  
13:34 <+tmortagne> vmassol: no specific link, just remembered seing in lots of blogs about java6 news that javadb was now embedded, if it's not then my proposal should not even exist from my POV  
13:35 <+tmortagne> vmassol: can you say it in the mail ?  
13:35 <vmassol> I did I think  
13:36 <vmassol> "I'm not 100% sure. Is javadb available in all JDKs? Isn't it only avail in the Oracle JDK?  
13:36 <vmassol> Also is it avail in the JRE?"  
13:36 <vmassol> and it seems it's only avail in the JDK and not in the JRE  
13:36 <vmassol> (I checked that one)  
13:39 <vmassol> sdumitriu: actually misc test is passing but with a NPE in the log  
13:39 <vmassol> checking that  
13:47 <+tmortagne> "I'm not 100% sure" is not the same as saying it's not part of JRE :)  
13:50 <+tmortagne> indeed it looks like it's not part of jre on ubuntu for example  
13:50 <@cjdelisle> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-3.0/20/console  
13:50 <+tmortagne> so I guess it's the same everywhere  
13:50 <@cjdelisle> out og permgen because it overrides the default settings, it worked before so I left it, removing it now.  
13:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <@cjdelisle> I'm off to bed, good luck stablizing the build.  
14:18 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki

14:29 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <vmassol> platform just built!  
14:51 <+tmortagne> :)  
14:54 <vmassol> marius is back! :)  
15:01 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
15:04 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Why wasn't the JAXB dependency needed? Is it included in Java6?  
15:04 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: yes7  
15:04 <+tmortagne> yes  
15:05 <+tmortagne> looking around for all the things like that  
15:06 <@sdumitriu> I'd like to test the build on an IcedTea once these dependencies are removed  
15:07 <+tmortagne> well it's a JSR so it should be ok, let me find you the JSR name  
15:07 <+tmortagne> (it's not like with javadb)  
15:08 <@sdumitriu> I know, but we must make sure XE runs on an open java implementation  
15:08 <+tmortagne> http://www.jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=222  
15:08 <@sdumitriu> If the implementation is incomplete, we should at least know about that  
15:09 <+tmortagne> well open java implementations are supposed to implement the JSRs  
15:09 <@sdumitriu> I'm not saying that there will be problems, just that we must check  
15:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: did you cehck the version included in the jdk?  
15:10 <+tmortagne> version of what ?  
15:10 <vmassol> (I remember the issue with xerces when it became included)  
15:10 <vmassol> jaxb  
15:10 <+tmortagne> no  
15:12 <+tmortagne> vmassol: "// This file was generated by the JavaTM Architecture for XML Binding(JAXB) Reference Implementation, v2.2.2-hudson-jaxb-ri-2.2-63- "  
15:12 <+tmortagne> so I guess it's 2.2.2  
15:13 <+tmortagne> which is the version we were using  
15:14 <+lucaa> hi guys  
15:15 <+lucaa> why isn't xwiki-enterprise-tests building on hudson>  
15:15 <+lucaa> ?  
15:15 <+lucaa> xwiki-enterprise just finished successfully  
15:15 <+lucaa> does anyone have any idea?  
15:19 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok good  
15:20 <vmassol> lucaa: indeed that looks wrong  
15:20 <vmassol> build failing tmortagne ;)  
15:22 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes i'm on it already, this is because of restlet trigering jaxb-api not on central repository (I removed the repository were we used to get jaxb)  
15:37 <+tmortagne> vmassol: should be ok now I hope, big cleanup around jaxb  
15:38 <+tmortagne> always nice to remove than many things :)  
15:38 <+tmortagne> s/than/that/  
15:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: good  
15:39 <vmassol> I'm trying to debug a test you wrote now....  
15:39 <+tmortagne> ha forgot annotations  
15:39 <vmassol> HTMLExportTest in misc tests  
15:40 <vmassol> it's failing on         zos.finish(); in HtmlPackager.java  
15:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you need to remove the jaxb stuff in annotation rest module too?  
15:42 <+tmortagne> vmassol: some stuff to cleanup and remove in annotation-rest yes  
15:42 <+tmortagne> usseless custom maven repositories etc...  
15:44 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it's mostly what is used to generate the model  
15:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm getting a broken pipe  
15:44 <+tmortagne> all the rest comes from xwiki-platform-rest dependency  
15:44 <vmassol> which is fun since you added code to not have a broken pipe ;)  
15:44 <vmassol> (in HTMLExportTest.java)  
15:45 <+tmortagne> vmassol: not sure what you are talking about actually, finishing with annotation and i'm looking  
15:45 <vmassol> k  
15:48 <+tmortagne> vmassol: can you add me to infra mailing list if it's not the case already  
15:49 <+sburjan> vmassol: add me too please  
15:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: done  
15:49 <+tmortagne> thanks  
15:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: you should hae received an email  
15:49 <vmassol> (I did it by default)  
15:50 <+tmortagne> yep received it, was not looking at the right place  
15:50 <vmassol> sburjan: done  
15:50 <+sburjan> vmassol: thanks. justrecieved the e-mail  
15:54 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok seen HTMLExportTest indeed it's weird you get a broken pipe but nothing changed there so I don't see why it would fail now  
15:55 <vmassol> the test is passing  
15:55 <vmassol> but on the console you get a bit stack trace  
15:55 <vmassol> so it could have been failing for a long time  
15:55 <+tmortagne> yes fail was not the  right word  
15:55 <+tmortagne> maybe it's because of something else  
15:56 <+tmortagne> will try to reproduce  
15:56 <vmassol> ok  
15:56 <vmassol> still trying to figure out why it's happening  
16:04 <vmassol> actually it fails on the second getNextEntry  
16:05 <vmassol> the first one is ok  
16:06 <vmassol> btw there's a small bug where the tmp dir is not removed when there's an exception but it's a different topic  
16:15 <+tmortagne> I  don't get a broken pipe but some other nasty exception server side  
16:15 <+tmortagne> even if the test pass  
16:15 <+tmortagne> http://pastebin.com/JYREbSj3  
16:17 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
16:19 <+tmortagne> XWikiException is very bad, the exception given to its constructor is not set as Exception cause...  
16:20 <+tmortagne> instead it has its own variable called exception...  
16:23 <vmassol> yes  
16:23 <vmassol> noticed it too  
16:38 <+lucaa> I'm looking at the xmlrpc tests, and they seem to be failing because removePage is failing  
16:39 <+lucaa> does anyone know anything about that? sdumitriu, I think there was an error in the trunk with that the other days?  
16:39 <@sdumitriu> Which removePage?  
16:39 <@sdumitriu> Looking at ci  
16:40 <+lucaa> org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException: Failed to invoke method removePage in class com.xpn.xwiki.xmlrpc.XWikiXmlRpcApiImpl: Error number 0 in 3: Exception while hibernate execute  
16:40 <+lucaa> Wrapped Exception: could not insert: [com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiDeletedDocument]  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.apache.xmlrpc.client.XmlRpcStreamTransport.readResponse(XmlRpcStreamTransport.java:184)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.apache.xmlrpc.client.XmlRpcStreamTransport.sendRequest(XmlRpcStreamTransport.java:145)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.apache.xmlrpc.client.XmlRpcHttpTransport.sendRequest(XmlRpcHttpTransport.java:94)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.apache.xmlrpc.client.XmlRpcSunHttpTransport.sendRequest(XmlRpcSunHttpTransport.java:39)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.apache.xmlrpc.client.XmlRpcClientWorker.execute(XmlRpcClientWorker.java:53)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.apache.xmlrpc.client.XmlRpcClient.execute(XmlRpcClient.java:166)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.apache.xmlrpc.client.XmlRpcClient.execute(XmlRpcClient.java:136)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.apache.xmlrpc.client.XmlRpcClient.execute(XmlRpcClient.java:125)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.xwiki.xmlrpc.XWikiXmlRpcClient.invokeRpc(XWikiXmlRpcClient.java:1023)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.xwiki.xmlrpc.XWikiXmlRpcClient.removePage(XWikiXmlRpcClient.java:399)  
16:40 <+lucaa>         at org.xwiki.test.xmlrpc.RenderingTest.testRenderPageContent(RenderingTest.java:141)  
16:40 <+lucaa> ci doesn't run the tests  
16:40 <+lucaa> for a reason that I don't understand  
16:41 <@sdumitriu> Hm, that's an interesting error  
16:41 <@sdumitriu> Do you have a nested exception?  
16:41 <+lucaa> I think I have more  
16:41 <+lucaa> no, that's all  
16:42 <+lucaa> there's more of that exception but no nested  
16:42 <+lucaa> you can build locally xwiki-enterprise-test-xmlrpc to see what is it about  
16:52 <@sdumitriu> I triggered a build on ci  
17:03 <+sburjan> guys, I have an issue.  I copy a page that has several translations .. like Main.WebHome. When I delete the copy of Main.WebhomeCopy, in the deleted pages from document index I get a lot of entries with the same name, but with different id's (/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHomeCopy?viewer=recyclebin&id=38). is this normal ?  
17:03 <vmassol> kind of  
17:03 <vmassol> it deletes all translations  
17:04 <vmassol> the only problem is that we need to display the translation language next to each page  
17:04 <vmassol> (in lots of places)  
17:04 <vmassol> as otherwise you can't differentiate  
17:04 <vmassol> (or group them together somehow)  
17:04 <vmassol> we have several jira issues opened for this  
17:04 <+sburjan> okay. this is why I asked first :)  
17:05 <+sburjan> almost done testing oracle :) I'm gonna user WebDav to give that wiki a hard time :)  
17:05 <vmassol> found errors?  
17:06 <+sburjan> well it crashed two times .. once when on Main.WebHome and clicking on a recently modified document, and once when trying to export as RTF  
17:07 <+sburjan> seems pretty random, I will ask for the stack trace to analyze it with Florin and others  
17:07 <+sburjan> but I wanna run also some webDav tests :)  
17:07 <+sburjan> a lot of small files for example  
17:07 <+sburjan> creating, deleting, etc  
17:10 <vmassol> lots of stuff failing  
17:10 <vmassol> - goto page failing  
17:10 <vmassol> - export failing in admin  
17:10 <vmassol> - save when addign property  
17:12 <vmassol> s/Adding property/adding object/  
17:12 <+lucaa> I can look at that test of you want, if nobody else feels guilty about it and wants to fix it fast  
17:12 <+lucaa> the prop add  
17:13 <+lucaa> and go to page  
17:20 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: I just uploaded 163 images using webdav, but AS doesn't see only about 10-12. is there a limit of items to be displayed ?  
17:20 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
17:20 <+sburjan> ok  
17:20 <+sburjan> gonna delete them now :D let's see what happens  
17:24 <Denis> has quit  
17:29 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Can you run findbugs:findbugs? I get an error  
17:31 <+sburjan> deleting a page will also delete its attachments ?  
17:34 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Yes  
17:34 <+lucaa> devs, mflorea, is there an existing issue with typing in the wysiwyg in FF4 from a selenium test or something?  
17:35 <+lucaa> I'm looking at failing org.xwiki.test.ui.framework.elements.editor.ProfileEditPage.setUserAbout(String)  
17:35 <+lucaa> it fails on line 119 Assert.assertEquals(USER\_ABOUT, this.customProfilePage.getUserAbout());  
17:35 <+lucaa> I debugged it and it seems the value is not set properly in the wysiwyg field  
17:37 <+mflorea> lucaa: I'm not aware of such an issue  
17:37 <+lucaa> would you like to look at that test? :D  
17:37 <+mflorea> I don't have time right now  
17:37 <vmassol> sdumitriu: on what module?  
17:38 <+mflorea> lucaa: you can leave it to me, I'll take a look over the weekend  
17:39 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:39 <+lucaa> ok  
17:40 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: Are you aware of a issue with Array#toJSON . It's undefined for me even though it was introduced in Prototype.js 1.5.1.  
17:55 <vmassol> mflorea: AddRemoveTagsTest is flickering  
17:56 <vmassol> to reproduce I've added a loop
